page.title: 05Scouting in Aston Clinton
page.content: The other day a hike was organised by ADC Scouts (Aylesbury District Scouts) they did all the organising. On the way we stopped at the local garage to get a chocolate bar and some drinks.It was from Coombe hill Monument to Ivinghoe Beacon (over night). When I got to Coombe Hill it was raining a little so everybody was wearing their spray tops etc. We left at about 9.30 PM, walked through the Hale and into Wendover Woods and down beside Daniels Trudge picnic spot. We arrived at Tring at 03.00 hrs, and sheltered and rested in Tring Library porch. This was built in 1984. We had to climb a lot of the Chiltern Hills. At last, after a long night we arrived at Ivinghoe Beacon at 05.00 hrs., tired but satisfied with our efforts.
